sentences: Lumen pehmeä valo teki talvesta kauniin. (The soft light of the snow made winter beautiful.)
Odotan innolla ensimmäistä lumisadetta talvella. (I am looking forward to the first snowfall in winter.)
Talvi on hyvää aikaa hiihtämiseen ja luistelulle. (Winter is a good time for skiing and skating.)
context: The Finnish word 'talvi' means 'winter'. It refers to the coldest season of the year. The word declines in different cases depending on its usage in a sentence, such as when talking about events *in* winter (adessive case: talvella) or possessing something related to winter (possessive forms like talveni - my winter).  The plural form is 'talvet'.
